name: Copley House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in town for 2 graduations and stayed at The Copley House because everything else was booked up! This was a true case of Serendipity as it ended up being such a great value for the price. Sure it's not the Ritz-Carlton, but the room was adequate and clean and the location can't be beat! You are right in the center of it all, a 5 minute walk from Boston's eponymous Newbury Street, a 10 minute walk to Boston Common and a 2 minute walk to the hip South End with great restaurants and shops (Jazz lovers check out the Beehive!). The room offers a small kitchen area, private bath and Cable and Internet. I would liken it to staying at a friends apartment. The staff is quite accommodating and helpful and they are young people who know what's up in the area. If you're looking to stay in the heart of it all without breaking the bank then this is the place for you.
reviews.title: Can't Beat The Value

reviews.text: From the previous reviews, it seems like rooms at Copley House can be very hit or miss, but I was quite pleased with my room at the property. I booked a medium studio (Room 104 at 215 W. Newton) not knowing exactly what to expect, but was pleasantly surprised to find a larger than average room with a new flat screen TV. The kitchen was fully stocked with utensils and cookware and had pretty much anything you would need to cook your own meals (minus the food, of course). The bathroom was clean and stocked with towels, and the rest of the room was clean as well.
reviews.title: Perfect for a weekend trip

reviews.text: Now for the drawbacks...the bed certainly wasn't the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in, but it didn't negatively affect my sleeping habits. The room I stayed in also faced the street, so any street noise could be heard, but it wasn't any louder than average. The hallway was also slightly dingy, and one minor complaint was that the blinds didn't reach all the way to the bottom of the window sill, as the room had windows that were quite tall.
reviews.title: Beware of Copley House

reviews.text: Other than that, I would definitely stay at Copley House again and recommend it to anyone needing a place to stay in Boston. The location is very hard to beat, especially for the price, as it is a few short blocks to all the shopping and the T at Prudential Center. And for a New Yorker like me who is used to walking, it's a short walk to Newbury Street and many other sites in the city.
reviews.title: absolutely sucked!

reviews.text: We've just come back home (in Montreal, Canada) from a three-night stay at Copley House, in Boston.
reviews.title: Home away from home in a great neighborhood
Feeling at home!
reviews.text: Congratulations to Mrs. Ritza Cornet and all the staff! This was the third time I have stayed at Copley House, but it was so far the best stay I had! A cozy studio, with stove, microwave, a mini-kitchen, a good tv set, good heating (it was freezing outside !), good shower. I have NOTHING, absolute NOTHING to complain about the hotel or about my stay. On the contrary, everybody was very kind, professional and gentle. No doubt I will stay there on my next visit to Boston. Oh! I forgot! Copley House is so near the best places to visit! Minute walking to Prudential Mall, Boyston Street, Newbury Street, etc... Minute walking also to metro station. Wonderful city, wonderful Copley House! I felt at home.

We booked this place thinking it would be nice, but it turned out to be a nightmare. The first day we checked in we were brought to another building down the street. The apartment was falling apart. Water leaking under the sink and the awful smell of an animal having stayed there. They should warn people that pets stay in there rooms because my allergies acted up and I could not sleep. The refrigerator made noise, the toilet ran, the tiles in the bathroom were cracked, water stains on the ceiling. This place had the worst maintenance ever! Not to mention the noises of the people staying next door. Loud street noise etc. etc
reviews.title: A Nightmare Don't Stay There!
Don't bother if staying at 239 W. Newton #501
reviews.text: The place we stayed in was considered a med. size studio apartment. It had a bed, mini kitchen, table , and bathroom. The price was reasonable and the area was cute, and near public transportation. However, it smelled like burnt popcorn, and the carpet was really dirty. I did not feel like it was clean. We stayed two nights because we had to everything else was booked.

This hotel is in a fabulous section of Boston. It is just blocks from the Prudential Center, Newbury Street, and very short walk to two different T stops, (Prudential on green line, and Back Bay on Orange line). In a quiet neighborhood of beautiful brownstones and a walking path to that orange line stop, it is a very safe area. We were warmly greeted and treated well at check in. We had a studio in the building on Newton St, which was very quiet. The room was small, but very clean and we really enjoyed having a kitchen. There were many wonderful resturants nearby on Tremont St. and a huge grocery at the Prudential complex. My traveling companion and I thought that this was a great value and we would recommend this hotel to our friends and will stay there again when visiting Boston.
reviews.title: Beautiful neighborhood, great value
Copley House Is Not A Good Experience. Avoid
reviews.text: The place is like a frat house. Doors slam, people crash up and down the stairs all night. The bathroom seemed to be falling apart. I just wanted out.

reviews.title: Not an Ordinary Hotel
reviews.text: My wife and I have stayed at Copley House at least half a dozen times. It is not to be compared to ordinary hotels, which are just that--ordinary. For one thing, its properties are located in one of the nicest neighborhoods in Boston, a charming area of tree-lined streets and remarkable quietness in the center of a vibrant city. All the apartments we've rented have included a well-equipped kitchenette, which is a big plus. In our experience the apartments have always been clean and comfortable. The Copley House staff were friendly and helpful. And the price of the rooms is modest compared to the price of hotels in this part of town. A basic room in any of those hotels costs at leat twice what Copley House charges for a room of similar size. Comparing like with like--and we have traveled to 10 cities in the past 12 months--this is a bargain.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Geoffrey and Anne Perret
reviews.title: Stay somewhere else
Horrible experience!
reviews.text: I am writing the review to save others from an awful experience.

First, we booked the room expecting and I am quoting the man on the phone, "A charming apartment" . However, there is little charming about being marched off to a different building with our suitcases and dumped off in a smelly room.
reviews.title: Decent hotel for the price

likes.liked: — Affordable rooms at the edge of the Back Bay neighborhood

reviews.text: I will list the problems . The room smelled like an old wet dog. My allergies went crazy because someone obviously had a pet in the room. The bathroom had broken tile, mold on the wall and the toilet was disgusting. The kitchen had old rodent traps around the refrigerator and stove. This apartment looked like someone fixed up an old closet or garage and threw a bed in there.
reviews.title: Clean, neat - great way to experience an apartment in a different city

likes.liked: — It was like living in someone's apartment in a different city.
likes.disliked: — My apartment was on the top floor - stairs were pretty steep to carry suitcases.

reviews.text: This place is in a great part of town--easy access to the Back Bay train station, and the orange and green T lines. It's nothing special, but it's pretty cheap. I paid $90 a night for a "studio" apartment. I was placed in one of the sister properties, a couple of blocks away on St. Batolph street I think. The studio was in the basement and it wasn't the most gorgeous place in the world but it was totally fine. If you are looking for a cute and "historic" looking room in an old Boston brownstone, I think you'll have to ask for that specifically. I doubt any of the the studios qualify.
reviews.title: Good rate, decent accomodations
Beware - Rate Scam
reviews.text: I made an on-line reservation for $70 per night plus tax. I called the hotel the next day to find out check-in times, and was told at that time they were not honoring the rate I had reserved. They were more than happy to reserve me a room for $120 per night plus tax. The employee said "they were going to call me" to let me know my rate was nearly doubling. Yeah, right. I had my cell phone with me all day, they never even tried. I'm sure they were hoping I would show up and agree to pay almost double to avoid being on the street. If you want to get ripped off by a hotel with no business ethics, then by all means, stay at this hotel.

reviews.title: Fawlty Towers USA Style
reviews.text: If you find yourself in the sister property 215 W. Newton ... run like hell and don't stop until you reach the Marriott.

Every time someone uses water in the building there is a resulting bang when the taps are turned off. On one night I didn't get to sleep until 1.30pm and was woken up at 5.00am! I checked out on the third day (and it only took me that long because I was busy working and no-one is in the office before 9.20am or after 7.00pm).
reviews.title: Nice Aparments, will stay there again

likes.disliked: — I had to walk up 3 floors of steep stairs!

reviews.text: The room cleaning is also shabby. The cleaner came intio my room and merely covered the bed with the top sheet to make it look as though it had been changed. If they had done nothing it wouldn't have bothered me, but to pretend....
reviews.title: Great Value, Great Location!

description: The Copley House is your home away from home in Boston, MA. We offer affordable lodging in fully furnished apartments at daily and weekly rates.
